p: The findings of this study unveil a silent yet profound legacy of COVID-19: genomic instability as a potential driver of long-term health complications in survivors. In conclusion, COVID-19 is not just a transient infection but a catalyst for long-term genomic disruption, leaving behind a trail of cellular damage that may shape the health of survivors for years to come. Understanding and addressing this silent legacy will be crucial in the ongoing battle against the pandemic’s enduring aftermath.
